channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A GOP push to restrict voting by overseas U.S. citizens continues before 2026 midterms

item.title: China's ride-hailing companies try to quell the smell in cars where some drivers sleep
item.description: China's ride-hailing car drivers work long hours to get enough fares, and often live in their cars. Companies and passengers are penalizing drivers fo...

item.title: Fool me once: the magical origin of the word hoax
item.description: Frauds, swindles, cons, scams, and deceptions are collectively known as hoaxes. But there's more than meets the eye.

item.title: Fans of the mysterious Mothman bring its West Virginia hometown new life

item.title: Man suspected of ordering murder of three Argentine women arrested
item.description: The brutal torture and killing of the three women in Argentina sent shockwaves through the region.

item.title: Government shutdown begins as nation faces new period of uncertainty

item.title: 9/30: The Daily Report
item.description: Tom Hanson reports on the looming government shutdown, a new agreement from Pfizer to sell some medications at discounted prices, and more.

item.title: State of calamity in Philippines province as earthquake kills 69
item.description: The earthquake comes barely more than a week after the country was hit by back-to-back typhoons.

item.title: South African firebrand MP Malema convicted of firing a gun in public
item.description: Julius Malema, known for his incendiary rhetoric, was recently convicted of hate speech.

item.title: Accused mastermind detained after livestreamed murders of women
item.description: The two women and girl were tortured and killed on a social media group of 45 users as a "warning" over an alleged drug theft, officials said

item.title: Activists say Gaza flotilla circled by Israeli warship
item.description: The Global Sumud Flotilla accused an Israeli vessel of steering "dangerously close" to one of its boats.
